description: A large hermit crab, peering out of its shell like a person answering a door, speaks to two smaller sea slugs on a beach. The scene presents an absurd juxtaposition of human-like social interaction, specifically a suburban-style visit and a tenant inquiry, occurring between marine invertebrates. The irony stems from the mundane, domestic scenario playing out in an unexpected oceanic environment. This surreal situation highlights the absurdity of applying human social constructs to the natural world. The interaction involves a notable large hermit crab and two distinct small sea slugs in a sandy, sparse marine environment with a sea anemone-like plant.
caption: “Sorry—Carl doesn't live here anymore.”
